column4: seriously, has ANYone in here had any luck with Bluetooth in ubuntu?
no, but I havent tried too hard to fix it
yes
so I should be downloading a 64 bit image of xubuntu?
If you want a 64 bit OS, then yeah, but you can run the regular 32 bit version fine
Some stuff might not work quite right in the 64 bit install though, so beware
if I install the 64 bit version, do I have less programs to choose from, or are the repos the same?
You'll probly have the same amount of programs, but certain things may not work, or you may have to jump through hoops to get working
like flash and stuff
ok, I'm just going to do 32bit for now then
That is a wise choice, most apps are not optimized for 64 bit yet anyway, so the performance gains are minimal
You installing edgy or dapper?
xubuntu, to be precise
With dapper, your cdrom may or may not work, also be sure you install the SMP kernel when its set up
whats SMP?
SMP enables both cores
nice!
What motherboard do you have?  (I have a C2D also)
good question. I'm not sure. I'm on a thinkpad.
At any rate, be sure you have see SMP when you do a 'uname -a' when you're up and running
I will check now
ok, its there
